intro: Berberis pavoniana, commonly known as the golden barberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by red-orange berries in the fall. The plant has spiny stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets, which are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant in temperate climates. Berberis pavoniana is also valued for its medicinal properties, as some of its parts contain alkaloids with potential therapeutic uses.
